DOC.brief_summary: This randomize prospective study compare three ablation strategy patient longstanding persistent atrial fibrillation ( LPeAF ) . It also explore best procedural endpoint among follow : circumferential pulmonary vein isolation ( PVI ) +left atrial ( LA ) linear lesion ( roof line , mitral isthmus ) +complex fractionate atrial electrogram ( CFAE ) ablation , PVI+LA linear lesion +cavotricuspid isthmus ( CTI ) ablation +CFAE ablation , PVI+CFAE ablation .
DOC.brief_title: Catheter Ablation Longstanding Persistent Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomize three ablation group : group A ( n=100 ) : PVI+LA linear ablation ( roof line mitral isthmus ) +CFAE ablation ; group B ( n=100 ) : PVI+linear ablation ( roof line , mitral isthmus , CTI ) +CFAE ablation ; group C ( n=100 ) , PVI+CFAE ablation .
DOC.criteria: Patients longstanding persistent atrial fibrillation ( last > 1 year ) Exhibited refractoriness least one antiarrhythmic drug Left atrial diameter < =60mm Patients uncontrolled congestive heart failure Having significant valvular disease and/or prosthetic heart valve ( ) With myocardial infarction stroke within 6 month screen With Significant congenital heart disease ; ejection fraction < 40 % measure echocardiography Allergic contrast medium Contraindication warfarin heparin Severe pulmonary disease e.g . restrictive pulmonary disease Chronic obstructive disease ( COPD ) Left atrial ( LA ) thrombus measure preprocedure transesophageal echocardiography Having contraindication right leave sided heart catheterization Poor general health Life expectancy le 6 month
